questions.question: What is a pointer in C++?
options: A variable that stores the address of another variable
A variable that stores a string
questions.correctAnswer: A variable that stores the address of another variable

questions.question: How do you declare a pointer to an integer?
What does the '*' operator do when used with a pointer?
options: It assigns a value to the pointer

questions.question: What is the result of the following code: 'int x = 10; int* p = &x; *p = 20;'?
What does the '&' operator do?
options: It returns the address of a variable
questions.correctAnswer: It returns the address of a variable

questions.question: How do you initialize a pointer to a variable?
What happens if you dereference a null pointer?
options: It returns the address of the variable

questions.question: What is a void pointer?
options: A pointer that can point to any data type
A pointer that does not point to anything
questions.correctAnswer: A pointer that can point to any data type
